column4: When downloading the kernel from kernel.org does that include the source?
ng,Cheers
Can anyone tell me how to update symlinks?
sudo ln -sf TARGET /path/to/link
How do I point that to a new kernel I downloaded using synaptic?
something like:  "sudo ln -s boot/vmlinuz-2.6.15-12-686 /vmlinuz"  -  but with the correct filename in /boot/
ty
I don't see it there
look in /boot/ - you'll see some vmlinux* files, no?
Yes but not the kernel I downloaded using synaptic
that's hard to believe.  synaptic always installs kernels into /boot/
Maybe Im not correct in saying that
that sounds more likely...
It  was the update thing that said the new kernel was out
So I selected the 686 kernel ver and downloaded
Any ideas?
what do you see if you run "grep -i 'installed linux-686' /var/log/dpkg.log | tail -1" in a terminal?
No such file or directory
For linux-686
I can't see that the kernel was installed, I see other things I got today, but not that
what command did that "no such file or directory" come from?
